description.value:
You summon &Reference[fey]{fey} spirits that take the form of beasts and appear in unoccupied spaces that you can see within range. Choose one of the following options for what appears:

  • One &Reference[beast]{beast} of challenge rating 2 or lower
  • Two beasts of challenge rating 1 or lower
  • Four beasts of challenge rating 1/2 or lower
  • Eight beasts of challenge rating 1/4 or lower

Each &Reference[beast]{beast} is also considered &Reference[fey]{fey}, and it disappears when it drops to 0 hit points or when the spell ends.

The summoned creatures are friendly to you and your companions. Roll initiative for the summoned creatures as a group, which has its own turns. They obey any &Reference[vocal]{verbal} commands that you issue to them (no action required by you). If you don't issue any commands to them, they defend themselves from hostile creatures, but otherwise take no actions.

The GM has the creatures' statistics. Sample creatures can be found below.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using certain higher-level spell slots, you choose one of the summoning options above, and more creatures appear: twice as many with a 5th-level slot, three times as many with a 7th-level slot, and four times as many with a 9th-level slot.

Sample Creatures

CR Creature Name
0 Frog, Sea Horse, Baboon, Badger, Bat, Cat, Crab, Deer, Eagle, &Reference[giant]{Giant} &Reference[fire]{Fire} Beetle, Goat, Hawk, Hyena, Jackal, Lizard, Octopus, Owl, Quipper, Rat, Raven, Scorpion, Spider, Vulture, Weasel
1/8 Blood Hawk, Camel, Flying Snake, &Reference[giant]{Giant} Crab, &Reference[giant]{Giant} Rat, &Reference[giant]{Giant} Weasel, Mastiff, Mule, Poisonous Snake, Pony, Stirge
1/4 Axe Beak, Boar, Constrictor Snake, Draft Horse, Elk, &Reference[giant]{Giant} Badger, &Reference[giant]{Giant} Bat, &Reference[giant]{Giant} Centipede, &Reference[giant]{Giant} Frog, &Reference[giant]{Giant} Lizard, &Reference[giant]{Giant} Owl, &Reference[giant]{Giant} Poisonous Snake, &Reference[giant]{Giant} Wolf Spider, Panther, Riding Horse, Wolf
1/2 Ape, Black Bear, Crocodile, &Reference[giant]{Giant} Goat, &Reference[giant]{Giant} Sea Horse, &Reference[giant]{Giant} Wasp, Reef Shark, Warhorse
1 Brown Bear, Dire Wolf, &Reference[giant]{Giant} Eagle, &Reference[giant]{Giant} Hyena, &Reference[giant]{Giant} Octopus, &Reference[giant]{Giant} Spider, &Reference[giant]{Giant} Toad, &Reference[giant]{Giant} Vulture, Lion, Tiger
2 &Reference[giant]{Giant} Boar, &Reference[giant]{Giant} Constrictor Snake, &Reference[giant]{Giant} Elk, Hunter Shark, Plesiosaurus, Polar Bear, Rhinoceros, Saber-toothed Tiger

You call forth an &Reference[elemental]{elemental} servant. Choose an area of air, earth, &Reference[fire]{fire}, or water that fills a 10-foot &Reference[cube]{cube} within range. An &Reference[elemental]{elemental} of challenge rating 5 or lower appropriate to the area you chose appears in an unoccupied space within 10 feet of it. For example, a &Reference[fire]{fire} &Reference[elemental]{elemental} emerges from a bonfire, and an earth &Reference[elemental]{elemental} rises up from the ground. The &Reference[elemental]{elemental} disappears when it drops to 0 hit points or when the spell ends.

The &Reference[elemental]{elemental} is friendly to you and your companions for the duration. Roll initiative for the &Reference[elemental]{elemental}, which has its own turns. It obeys any &Reference[vocal]{verbal} commands that you issue to it (no action required by you). If you don't issue any commands to the &Reference[elemental]{elemental}, it defends itself from hostile creatures but otherwise takes no actions.

If your &Reference[concentration]{concentration} is broken, the &Reference[elemental]{elemental} doesn't disappear. Instead, you lose control of the &Reference[elemental]{elemental}, it becomes hostile toward you and your companions, and it might attack. An uncontrolled &Reference[elemental]{elemental} can't be dismissed by you, and it disappears 1 hour after you summoned it.

The GM has the elemental's statistics. Sample elementals can be found below.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the challenge rating increases by 1 for each slot level above 5th.

Sample Elementals

CR Creature Name
1/4 Steam Mephit
1/2 Dust Mephit, Ice Mephit, Magma Mephit, Magmin
2 Azer, Gargoyle
5 Air &Reference[elemental]{Elemental}, Earth &Reference[elemental]{Elemental}, &Reference[fire]{Fire} &Reference[elemental]{Elemental}, Salamander, Water &Reference[elemental]{Elemental}, Xorn
6 &Reference[invisible]{Invisible} Stalker

materials.value: burning incense for air, soft clay for earth, sulfur and phosphorus for fire, or water and sand for water

description.value:
You summon elementals that appear in unoccupied spaces that you can see within range. You choose one the following options for what appears:

  • One &Reference[elemental]{elemental} of challenge rating 2 or lower
  • Two elementals of challenge rating 1 or lower
  • Four elementals of challenge rating 1/2 or lower
  • Eight elementals of challenge rating 1/4 or lower.


An &Reference[elemental]{elemental} summoned by this spell disappears when it drops to 0 hit points or when the spell ends.

The summoned creatures are friendly to you and your companions. Roll initiative for the summoned creatures as a group, which has its own turns. They obey any &Reference[vocal]{verbal} commands that you issue to them (no action required by you). If you don't issue any commands to them, they defend themselves from hostile creatures, but otherwise take no actions.

The GM has the creatures' statistics.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using certain higher-level spell slots, you choose one of the summoning options above, and more creatures appear: twice as many with a 6th-level slot and three times as many with an 8th-level slot.

Sample Elementals

CR Monster
1/4 Steam Mephit
1/2 Dust Mephit, Ice Mephit, Magma Mephit, Magmin
2 Azer, Gargoyle

You summon &Reference[fey]{fey} creatures that appear in unoccupied spaces that you can see within range. Choose one of the following options for what appears:

  • One &Reference[fey]{fey} creature of challenge rating 2 or lower
  • Two &Reference[fey]{fey} creatures of challenge rating 1 or lower
  • Four &Reference[fey]{fey} creatures of challenge rating 1/2 or lower
  • Eight &Reference[fey]{fey} creatures of challenge rating 1/4 or lower


A summoned creature disappears when it drops to 0 hit points or when the spell ends.

The summoned creatures are friendly to you and your companions. Roll initiative for the summoned creatures as a group, which have their own turns. They obey any &Reference[vocal]{verbal} commands that you issue to them (no action required by you). If you don't issue any commands to them, they defend themselves from hostile creatures, but otherwise take no actions.

The GM has the creatures' statistics. You can see some sample creatures below.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using certain higher-level spell slots, you choose one of the summoning options above, and more creatures appear: twice as many with a 6th-level slot and three times as many with an 8th-level slot.

Sample Creatures

CR Creature
1/4 Blink Dog, Sprite
1/2 Satyr
1 Dryad
2 Sea Hag

materials.value: one holly berry per creature summoned

description.value:
For the duration, you sense the presence of magic within 30 feet of you. If you sense magic in this way, you can use your action to see a faint aura around any visible creature or object in the area that bears magic, and you learn its school of magic, if any.

The spell can penetrate most barriers, but it is blocked by 1 foot of stone, 1 inch of common metal, a thin sheet of lead, or 3 feet of wood or dirt.

You cause a tremor in the ground within range. Each creature other than you in that area must make a &Reference[dex]{Dexterity} saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 1d6 &Reference[bludgeoning]{bludgeoning} damage and is knocked &Reference[prone]{prone}. If the ground in that area is loose earth or stone, it becomes difficult terrain until cleared, with each 5-foot-diameter portion requiring at least 1 minute to clear by hand.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 1st.

Grasping weeds and vines sprout from the ground in a 20-foot square starting from a point within range. For the duration, these plants turn the ground in the area into difficult terrain.

A creature in the area when you cast the spell must succeed on a &Reference[str]{Strength} saving throw or be &Reference[restrained]{restrained} by the entangling plants until the spell ends. A creature &Reference[restrained]{restrained} by the plants can use its action to make a &Reference[str]{Strength} check against your spell save DC. On a success, it frees itself.

When the spell ends, the conjured plants wilt away.

description.value:
Each object in a 20-foot &Reference[cube]{cube} within range is outlined in blue, green, or violet light (your choice). Any creature in the area when the spell is cast is also outlined in light if it fails a &Reference[dex]{Dexterity} saving throw. For the duration, objects and affected creatures shed dim light in a 10-foot radius.

Any attack roll against an affected creature or object has advantage if the attacker can see it, and the affected creature or object can't benefit from being &Reference[invisible]{invisible}.

You evoke a fiery blade in your free hand. The blade is similar in size and shape to a scimitar, and it lasts for the duration. If you let go of the blade, it disappears, but you can evoke the blade again as a bonus action.

You can use your action to make a melee spell attack with the fiery blade. On a hit, the target takes 3d6 &Reference[fire]{fire} damage.

The flaming blade sheds bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 for every two slot levels above 2nd.

materials.value: leaf of sumac

description.value:
You create a 20-foot-radius &Reference[sphere]{sphere} of fog centered on a point within range. The &Reference[sphere]{sphere} spreads around corners, and its area is heavily obscured. It lasts for the duration or until a wind of moderate or greater speed (at least 10 miles per hour) disperses it.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the radius of the fog increases by 20 feet for each slot level above 1st.

A &Reference[nat]{nature} spirit answers your call and transforms you into a powerful guardian. The transformation lasts until the spell ends. You choose one of the following forms to assume: Primal &Reference[beast]{Beast} or Great Tree.

Primal &Reference[beast]{Beast}. Bestial fur covers your body, your facial features become feral, and you gain the following benefits:

  • Your walking speed increases by 10 feet.
  • You gain &Reference[darkvision]{darkvision} with a range of 120 feet.
  • You make Strength-based attack rolls with advantage.
  • Your melee weapon attacks deal an extra 1d6 &Reference[force]{force} damage on a hit.

Great Tree. Your skin appears barky, leaves sprout from your hair, and you gain the following benefits:

  • You gain 10 temporary hit points.
  • You make &Reference[con]{Constitution} saving throws with advantage.
  • You make Dexterity- and Wisdom-based attack rolls with advantage.
  • While you are on the ground, the ground within 15 feet of you is difficult terrain for your enemies.

A &Reference[line]{line} of strong wind 60 feet long and 10 feet wide blasts from you in a direction you choose for the spell's duration. Each creature that starts its turn in the &Reference[line]{line} must succeed on a &Reference[str]{Strength} saving throw or be pushed 15 feet away from you in a direction following the &Reference[line]{line}.

Any creature in the &Reference[line]{line} must spend 2 feet of movement for every 1 foot it moves when moving closer to you.

The gust disperses gas or vapor, and it extinguishes candles, torches, and similar unprotected flames in the area. It causes protected flames, such as those of lanterns, to dance wildly and has a 50 percent chance to extinguish them.

As a bonus action on each of your turns before the spell ends, you can change the direction in which the &Reference[line]{line} blasts from you.

materials.value: a legume seed

description.value:
You call forth a &Reference[nat]{nature} spirit to soothe the wounded. The intangible spirit appears in a space that is a 5-foot &Reference[cube]{cube} you can see within range. The spirit looks like a transparent &Reference[beast]{beast} or &Reference[fey]{fey} (your choice).

Until the spell ends, whenever you or a creature you can see moves into the spirit’s space for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, you can cause the spirit to restore 1d6 hit points to that creature (no action required). The spirit can’t heal constructs or &Reference[undead]{undead}. The spirit can heal a number of times equal to 1 + your spellcasting ability modifier (minimum of twice). After healing that number of times, the spirit disappears.

As a bonus action on your turn, you can move the spirit up to 30 feet to a space you can see.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the healing increases by 1d6 for each slot level above 2nd.

Choose a manufactured metal object, such as a metal weapon or a suit of heavy or medium metal armor, that you can see within range. You cause the object to glow red-hot. Any creature in physical contact with the object takes 2d8 &Reference[fire]{fire} damage when you cast the spell. Until the spell ends, you can use a bonus action on each of your subsequent turns to cause this damage again.

If a creature is holding or wearing the object and takes the damage from it, the creature must succeed on a &Reference[con]{Constitution} saving throw or drop the object if it can. If it doesn’t drop the object, it has disadvantage on attack rolls and ability checks until the start of your next turn.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 2nd.

system.chatFlavor: [2d8 - fire] Use a bonus action on each subsequent turn to cause this damage again

materials.value: a piece of iron and a flame

description.value:
Choose a &Reference[humanoid]{humanoid} that you can see within range. The target must succeed on a &Reference[wis]{Wisdom} saving throw or be &Reference[paralyzed]{paralyzed} for the duration. At the end of each of its turns, the target can make another &Reference[wis]{Wisdom} saving throw. On a success, the spell ends on the target.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, you can target one additional &Reference[humanoid]{humanoid} for each slot level above 2nd. The humanoids must be within 30 feet of each other when you target them.

materials.value: a small, straight piece of iron

description.value:
A hail of rock-hard ice pounds to the ground in a 20-foot-radius, 40-foot-high &Reference[cylinder]{cylinder} centered on a point within range. Each creature in the &Reference[cylinder]{cylinder} must make a &Reference[dex]{Dexterity} saving throw. A creature takes 2d8 &Reference[bludgeoning]{bludgeoning} damage and 4d6 &Reference[cold]{cold} damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

Hailstones turn the storm's area of effect into difficult terrain until the end of your next turn.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, the &Reference[bludgeoning]{bludgeoning} damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 4th.

materials.value: a pinch of dust and a few drops of water

description.value:
A wave of healing energy washes out from a point of your choice within range. Choose up to six creatures in a 30-foot-radius &Reference[sphere]{sphere} centered on that point. Each target regains hit points equal to 3d8 + your spellcasting ability modifier. This spell has no effect on &Reference[undead]{undead} or constructs.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, the healing increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 5th.

A silvery beam of pale light shines down in a 5-foot-radius, 40-foot-high &Reference[cylinder]{cylinder} centered on a point within range. Until the spell ends, dim light fills the &Reference[cylinder]{cylinder}.

When a creature enters the spell’s area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it is engulfed in ghostly flames that cause searing pain, and it must make a &Reference[con]{Constitution} saving throw. It takes 2d10 &Reference[radiant]{radiant} damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

A shapechanger makes its saving throw with disadvantage. If it fails, it also instantly reverts to its original form and can’t assume a different form until it leaves the spell’s light.

On each of your turns after you cast this spell, you can use an action to move the beam up to 60 feet in any direction.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d10 for each slot level above 2nd.

materials.value: several seeds of any moonseed plant and a piece of opalescent feldspar

description.value: A veil of shadows and silence radiates from you, masking you and your companions from detection. For the duration, each creature you choose within 30 feet of you (including you) has a +10 bonus to &Reference[dex]{Dexterity} (&Reference[ste]{Stealth}) checks and can't be tracked except by magical means. A creature that receives this bonus leaves behind no tracks or other traces of its passage.

materials.value: ashes from a burned leaf of mistletoe and a sprig of spruce

description.value:
Until the spell ends, freezing rain and sleet fall in a 20-foot-tall &Reference[cylinder]{cylinder} with a 40-foot radius centered on a point you choose within range. The area is heavily obscured, and exposed flames in the area are doused.

The ground in the area is covered with slick ice, making it difficult terrain. When a creature enters the spell's area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there, it must make a &Reference[dex]{Dexterity} saving throw. On a failed save, it falls &Reference[prone]{prone}.

If a creature starts its turn in the spell's area and is concentrating on a spell, the creature must make a successful &Reference[con]{Constitution} saving throw against your spell save DC or lose &Reference[concentration]{concentration}.

materials.value: a pinch of dust and a few drops of water

description.value:
The ground in a 20-foot radius centered on a point within range twists and sprouts hard spikes and thorns. The area becomes difficult terrain for the duration. When a creature moves into or within the area, it takes 2d4 &Reference[piercing]{piercing} damage for every 5 feet it travels.

The transformation of the ground is camouflaged to look natural. Any creature that can't see the area at the time the spell is cast must make a &Reference[wis]{Wisdom} (&Reference[prc]{Perception}) check against your spell save DC to recognize the terrain as hazardous before entering it.

materials.value: seven sharp thorns or seven small twigs, each sharpened to a point

description.value:
You call forth a bestial spirit. It manifests in an unoccupied space that you can see within range. This corporeal form uses the Bestial Spirit stat block. When you cast the spell, choose an environment: Air, Land, or Water. The creature resembles an animal of your choice that is native to the chosen environment, which determines certain traits in its stat block. The creature disappears when it drops to 0 hit points or when the spell ends.

The creature is an ally to you and your companions. In combat, the creature shares your initiative count, but it takes its turn immediately after yours. It obeys your &Reference[vocal]{verbal} commands (no action required by you). If you don’t issue any, it takes the Dodge action and uses its move to avoid danger.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, use the higher level wherever the spell’s level appears in the stat block.

Bestial Spirit

Small &Reference[beast]{beast}

Armor Class 11 + the level of the spell (natural armor)

Hit Points 20 (Air only) or 30 (Land and Water only) + 5 for each spell level above 2nd

Speed 30 ft.; climb 30 ft. (Land only); fly 60 ft. (Air only); swim 30 ft. (Water only)

STR
18 (+4)
DEX
11 (+0)
CON
16 (+3)

4 (−3)
WIS
14 (+2)

5 (−3)

Senses &Reference[darkvision]{darkvision} 60 ft., passive &Reference[prc]{Perception} 12

Languages understands the languages you speak

Challenge — Proficiency Bonus equals your bonus

Flyby (Air Only). The &Reference[beast]{beast} doesn’t provoke opportunity attacks when it flies out of an enemy’s reach.

Pack Tactics (Land and Water Only). The &Reference[beast]{beast} has advantage on an attack roll against a creature if at least one of the beast’s allies is within 5 feet of the creature and the ally isn’t &Reference[incapacitated]{incapacitated}.

Water Breathing (Water Only). The &Reference[beast]{beast} can breathe only underwater.

Actions

Multiattack. The &Reference[beast]{beast} makes a number of attacks equal to half this spell’s level (rounded down).

Maul. Melee Weapon Attack: your spell attack modifier to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. Hit: 1d8 + 4 + the spell’s level &Reference[piercing]{piercing} damage.

materials.value: a feather, tuft of fur, and fish tail inside a gilded acorn worth at least 200 gp

description.value:
You call forth a draconic spirit. It manifests in an unoccupied space that you can see within range. This corporeal form uses the Draconic Spirit stat block. When you cast this spell, choose a family of dragon: chromatic, gem, or metallic. The creature resembles a &Reference[dragon]{dragon} of the chosen family, which determines certain traits in its stat block. The creature disappears when it drops to 0 hit points or when the spell ends.

The creature is an ally to you and your companions. In combat, the creature shares your initiative count, but it takes its turn immediately after yours. It obeys your &Reference[vocal]{verbal} commands (no action required by you). If you don’t issue any, it takes the Dodge action and uses its move to avoid danger.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th level or higher, use the higher level wherever the spell’s level appears in the stat block.

Draconic Spirit

Large &Reference[dragon]{Dragon}, Neutral

Armor Class 14 + the level of the spell (natural armor)

Hit Points 50 + 10 for each spell level above 5th (the &Reference[dragon]{dragon} has a number of Hit Dice [d10s] equal to the level of the spell)

Speed 30 ft., fly 60 ft., swim 30 ft.

19 (+4)

Damage Resistances (Gem Only) &Reference[force]{force}, &Reference[necrotic]{necrotic}, &Reference[psychic]{psychic}, &Reference[radiant]{radiant}, &Reference[thunder]{thunder}

Condition Immunities &Reference[charmed]{charmed}, &Reference[frightened]{frightened}, &Reference[poisoned]{poisoned}

Senses &Reference[blindsight]{blindsight} 30 ft., &Reference[darkvision]{darkvision} 60 ft., passive &Reference[prc]{Perception} 12

Languages Draconic, understands the languages you speak

Challenge — Proficiency Bonus equals your bonus

Shared Resistances. When you summon the &Reference[dragon]{dragon}, choose one of its damage resistances. You have resistance to the chosen damage type until the spell ends.

Actions

Multiattack. The &Reference[dragon]{dragon} makes a number of Rend attacks equal to half the spell’s level (rounded down), and it uses Breath Weapon.

Rend. Melee Weapon Attack: your spell attack modifier to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. Hit: 1d6 + 4 + the spell’s level &Reference[piercing]{piercing} damage.

Breath Weapon. The &Reference[dragon]{dragon} exhales destructive energy in a 30-foot &Reference[cone]{cone}. Each creature in that area must make a &Reference[dex]{Dexterity} saving throw against your spell save DC. A creature takes 2d6 damage of a type this &Reference[dragon]{dragon} has resistance to (your choice) on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one.

materials.value: an object with the image of a dragon engraved on it, worth at least 500 gp

description.value:
You call forth an &Reference[elemental]{elemental} spirit. It manifests in an unoccupied space that you can see within range. This corporeal form uses the &Reference[elemental]{Elemental} Spirit stat block. When you cast the spell, choose an element: Air, Earth, &Reference[fire]{Fire}, or Water. The creature resembles a bipedal form wreathed in the chosen element, which determines certain traits in its stat block. The creature disappears when it drops to 0 hit points or when the spell ends.

The creature is an ally to you and your companions. In combat, the creature shares your initiative count, but it takes its turn immediately after yours. It obeys your &Reference[vocal]{verbal} commands (no action required by you). If you don’t issue any, it takes the Dodge action and uses its move to avoid danger.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 5th level or higher, use the higher level wherever the spell’s level appears in the stat block.

&Reference[elemental]{Elemental} Spirit

Medium &Reference[elemental]{elemental}

Armor Class 11 + the level of the spell (natural armor)

Hit Points 50 + 10 for each spell level above 4th

Damage Immunities poison; &Reference[fire]{fire} (&Reference[fire]{Fire} only)

Condition Immunities exhaustion, &Reference[paralyzed]{paralyzed}, &Reference[petrified]{petrified}, &Reference[poisoned]{poisoned}, &Reference[unconscious]{unconscious}

description.value:
You call forth a &Reference[fey]{fey} spirit. It manifests in an unoccupied space that you can see within range. This corporeal form uses the &Reference[fey]{Fey} Spirit stat block. When you cast the spell, choose a mood: Fuming, Mirthful, or Tricksy. The creature resembles a &Reference[fey]{fey} creature of your choice marked by the chosen mood, which determines one of the traits in its stat block. The creature disappears when it drops to 0 hit points or when the spell ends.

The creature is an ally to you and your companions. In combat, the creature shares your initiative count, but it takes its turn immediately after yours. It obeys your &Reference[vocal]{verbal} commands (no action required by you). If you don’t issue any, it takes the Dodge action and uses its move to avoid danger.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 4th level or higher, use the higher level wherever the spell’s level appears in the stat block.

Bonus Actions

&Reference[fey]{Fey} Step. The &Reference[fey]{fey} magically teleports up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space it can see. Then one of the following effects occurs, based on the fey’s chosen mood:

Fuming. The &Reference[fey]{fey} has advantage on the next attack roll it makes before the end of this turn.

Mirthful. The &Reference[fey]{fey} can &Reference[force]{force} one creature it can see within 10 feet of it to make a &Reference[wis]{Wisdom} saving throw against your spell save DC. Unless the save succeeds, the target is &Reference[charmed]{charmed} by you and the &Reference[fey]{fey} for 1 minute or until the target takes any damage.

Tricksy. The &Reference[fey]{fey} can fill a 5-foot &Reference[cube]{cube} within 5 feet of it with magical darkness, which lasts until the end of its next turn.

description.value:
A wave of thunderous &Reference[force]{force} sweeps out from you. Each creature in a 15-foot &Reference[cube]{cube} originating from you must make a &Reference[con]{Constitution} saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 2d8 &Reference[thunder]{thunder} damage and is pushed 10 feet away from you. On a successful save, the creature takes half as much damage and isn't pushed.

In addition, unsecured objects that are completely within the area of effect are automatically pushed 10 feet away from you by the spell's effect, and the spell emits a thunderous boom audible out to 300 feet.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 2nd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d8 for each slot level above 1st.

You conjure up a wave of water that crashes down on an area within range. The area can be up to 30 feet long, up to 10 feet wide, and up to 10 feet tall. Each creature in that area must make a &Reference[dex]{Dexterity} saving throw. On a failed save, a creature takes 4d8 &Reference[bludgeoning]{bludgeoning} damage and is knocked &Reference[prone]{prone}. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage and isn’t knocked &Reference[prone]{prone}. The water then spreads out across the ground in all directions, extinguishing unprotected flames in its area and within 30 feet of it, and then it vanishes.

materials.value: a drop of water

description.value:
You invoke both death and life upon a 10-foot-radius &Reference[sphere]{sphere} centered on a point within range. Each creature of your choice in that area must make a &Reference[con]{Constitution} saving throw, taking 2d6 &Reference[necrotic]{necrotic} damage on a failed save, or half as much damage on a successful one. Nonmagical vegetation in that area withers.

In addition, one creature of your choice in that area can spend and roll one of its unspent Hit Dice and regain a number of hit points equal to the roll plus your spellcasting ability modifier.

At Higher Levels. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 3rd level or higher, the damage increases by 1d6 for each slot above the 2nd, and the number of Hit Dice that can be spent and added to the healing roll increases by one for each slot above 2nd.

biography.value:
Backstory

My earliest memory is being alone in the forest. I had wandered for days with little food and water. Alone and near death I found myself in the darkness surrounded by glowing eyes and snarling teeth. I knew that I was doomed and I braced myself for death. Just as my life was certainly coming to an end, I heard the sound of arrows whipping through the trees. My next memory is is waking up on a on a soft bed of leaves, elves whispering softly in the background. I finally felt safe and warm. I was always grateful to the tribe for saving my life and taking me in. The wood elves of the Size tribe lived in the wilderness, far from the cities and towns of the human races. They lived a simple life of seasonal foraging and migration. They were the protectors of the forest and the creatures within. I always had food, water, and a place to rest my bones, but I never truly felt that I belonged. Despite those feelings I was happy and lived in peace and harmony with the land and my tribe. I learned the druidic arts from the elders and continued their traditions. After a long trip to the edge of the wilds I returned to our camp very late after getting trapped for some time by the morning lord's wrath. To my horror the camp had been burned to the ground and everyone had had been slaughtered. For several years after I wandered the wilderness alone living off of the land. One day I stumbled upon a band of adventurers that had nearly died from starvation. I nursed them back to health and when they recovered I decided to stay with them as they traveled. Time went on and I found myself traveling further and further away from home. I visited many distant lands as the years passed. I learned many new skills and the languages of the locals. Most recently a vision has put me back on the path to my homeland. I knew that this was a journey that I must make without my friends. I slipped away from camp late one night making sure that I could not be followed. I don't know exactly where this path leads but I know where the path starts... a small village in Barovia.
